00056 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00057 {
00058         // Search in the current working directory if no argument was provided
00059         char* searchPath = (argc > 1)
00060                 ? argv[1]
00061                 : ".";
00062         
00063         // Start the search at the specified path
00064         do_file(searchPath, argv);
00065 
00066         return 0;
00067 }

00074 void do_file(const char* file_name, const char* const parms[])
00075 {
00076         struct stat fileInfo;
00077 
00078         // Read file information (without following symbolic links)
00079         int result = lstat(file_name, &fileInfo);
00080 
00081         if (result == -1)
00082         {
00083                 fprintf(stderr, "Reading information of file \"%s\" has failed with error code %d: %s\n", file_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00084 
00085                 return;
00086         }
00087 
00088         // Print the information of this file or directory
00089         PrintFileInformation(file_name, &fileInfo, parms);
00090 
00091         // Continue the search in subdirectories if the "file" is actually a directory
00092         if (S_ISDIR(fileInfo.st_mode))
00093         {
00094                 do_dir(file_name, parms);
00095         }
00096 }
00097 
00101 void do_dir(const char* dir_name, const char* const parms[])
00102 {
00103         // TODO: Change the working directory to the provided one. Otherwise, reading file information will fail if the paths get too long.
00104 
00105 
00106         // Open the specified directory
00107         DIR* pDir = opendir(dir_name);
00108 
00109         if (pDir == NULL)
00110         {
00111                 fprintf(stderr, "Opening directory \"%s\" has failed with error code %d: %s\n", dir_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00112 
00113                 return;
00114         }
00115 
00116         
00117         // If we keep the current directory open while descending further
00118         // down the directory tree, we might run into the open file limit.
00119         // Therefore, we will read all entries of the current directory
00120         // into a linked list and close the directory right away.
00121 
00122         // The head of the linked list that stores the file names of the current directory
00123         struct FileNode* head = NULL;
00124 
00125         struct dirent* directoryInfo = NULL;
00126 
00127         do
00128         {
00129                 // Reset error for the subsequent library call
00130                 errno = 0;
00131 
00132                 // Read directory information
00133                 directoryInfo = readdir(pDir);
00134 
00135                 if (directoryInfo == NULL)
00136                 {
00137                         // If no error value is set, it indicates that the end of the directory stream has been reached
00138                         if (errno != 0)
00139                                 fprintf(stderr, "Reading directory \"%s\" has failed with error code %d: %s\n", dir_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00140 
00141                         break;
00142                 }
00143 
00144                 // Ignore the directory entries that represent the current and the parent directory
00145                 if (!strcmp(directoryInfo->d_name, ".") || !strcmp(directoryInfo->d_name, ".."))
00146                         continue;
00147 
00148 
00149                 // Add the directory name to the temporary list
00150                 AddListNode(&head, directoryInfo->d_name);
00151         }
00152         while (directoryInfo != NULL);
00153 
00154 
00155         // Close the directory
00156         int result = closedir(pDir);
00157 
00158         if (result == -1)
00159         {
00160                 fprintf(stderr, "Closing directory \"%s\" has failed with error code %d: %s\n", dir_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00161 
00162                 return;
00163         }
00164 
00165 
00166         // Iterate over the list of file names 
00167         struct FileNode* node = head;
00168 
00169         while (node != NULL)
00170         {
00171                 // TODO:
00172                 // CombinePath() might be unnecessary since the file system accepts duplicated
00173                 // slashes in paths (".////doc" will be treated the same as "./doc"). Simply
00174                 // concatenate dir_name and directoryInfo->d_name with a slash in between.
00175 
00176                 // Construct the combined path of the file, taking care of duplicated slashes
00177                 char* filePath = CombinePath(dir_name, node->fileName);
00178 
00179                 // Process files and directories below the current one
00180                 do_file(filePath, parms);
00181 
00182                 // Free the previously allocated, combined path string
00183                 free(filePath);
00184 
00185 
00186                 // Continue with the next entry in the list
00187                 node = node->next;
00188         }
00189 
00190         // Free the temporary list
00191         FreeList(&head);
00192 
00193 
00194 
00195         // Return to the parent directory
00196         /*result = chdir("..");
00197 
00198         if (result == -1)
00199         {
00200                 fprintf(stderr, "Changing the current working directory to the parent directory has failed with error code %d: %s\n", dir_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00201 
00202                 return;
00203         }*/
00204 }

00211 char* CombinePath(const char* path1, const char* path2)
00212 {
00213         // Determine the number of characters in the input strings
00214         int path1Len = strlen(path1);
00215         int path2Len = strlen(path2);
00216 
00217         // Check if both or either of the strings is empty
00218         if ((path1Len == 0) && (path2Len == 0))
00219         {
00220                 return strdup("");
00221         }
00222         else if (path1Len == 0)
00223         {
00224                 return strdup(path2);
00225         }
00226         else if (path2Len == 0)
00227         {
00228                 return strdup(path1);
00229         }
00230 
00231 
00232         // Allocate sufficient memory for concatenating the paths plus the directory separator and string terminator
00233         char* combined = calloc(path1Len + path2Len + 2, sizeof(char));
00234 
00235         if (combined == NULL)
00236         {
00237                 // Out of memory
00238                 exit(-1);
00239         }
00240 
00241 
00242         // Check if the first path ends with a directory-separating slash
00243         int path1HasTrailingSlash =
00244                 (path1Len > 0) && (path1[path1Len - 1] == '/');
00245 
00246         // Check if the second path starts with a directory-separating slash
00247         int path2HasLeadingSlash =
00248                 (path2Len > 0) && (path2[0] == '/');
00249 
00250         if (path1HasTrailingSlash && path2HasLeadingSlash)
00251         {
00252                 // Both paths contain a slash; Trim the slash from the first path and concatenate
00253                 strncat(combined, path1, path1Len - 1);
00254                 strcat(combined, path2);
00255         }
00256         else if (path1HasTrailingSlash || path2HasLeadingSlash)
00257         {
00258                 // Only one path contains a slash; Concatenate the paths as they are
00259                 strcat(combined, path1);
00260                 strcat(combined, path2);
00261         }
00262         else
00263         {
00264                 // Neither path contains a slash; Concatenate the paths with a slash in between
00265                 strcat(combined, path1);
00266                 strcat(combined, "/");
00267                 strcat(combined, path2);
00268         }
00269 
00270         return combined;
00271 }

00278 void PrintFileInformation(const char* filePath, const struct stat* fileInformation, const char* const parms[])
00279 {
00280         // TODO:
00281         // Apply the command line actions to determine whether this file should
00282         // be ignored. Exit without printing any information in that case.
00283 
00284         // TODO:
00285         // Print in extended format when the -ls action was specified.
00286 
00287         
00288         int i = 0;
00289         
00290         while (parms[i] != NULL)
00291         {
00292                 if (strcmp(parms[i], "-ls"))
00293                 {
00294                 }
00295                 else if (strcmp(parms[i], "-user"))
00296                 {
00297                 }
00298                 else if (strcmp(parms[i], "-name"))
00299                 {
00300                 }
00301                 else if (strcmp(parms[i], "-type"))
00302                 {
00303                 }
00304                 else if (strcmp(parms[i], "-nouser"))
00305                 {
00306                 }
00307                 else if (strcmp(parms[i], "-path"))
00308                 {
00309                 }
00310                 
00311                 i++;
00312         }
00313         
00314         // Print the file information
00315         printf("%s\n", filePath);
00316 }

00323 struct FileNode* AddListNode(struct FileNode** head, char* fileName)
00324 {
00325         assert(head != NULL);
00326         assert(fileName != NULL);
00327 
00328 
00329         // Create the new node
00330         struct FileNode* node = malloc(sizeof(struct FileNode));
00331 
00332         node->fileName = strdup(fileName);
00333         node->next = NULL;
00334 
00335 
00336         // Add the node to the list
00337         if (*head == NULL)
00338         {
00339                 // This is the first element
00340                 *head = node;
00341         }
00342         else
00343         {
00344                 // Find the last node in the list
00345                 struct FileNode* tail = *head;
00346 
00347                 while (tail->next != NULL)
00348                         tail = tail->next;
00349 
00350                 // Add the new node at the end of the list
00351                 tail->next = node;
00352         }
00353 
00354         return node;
00355 }
00356 
00359 void FreeList(struct FileNode** head)
00360 {
00361         assert(head != NULL);
00362 
00363 
00364         // Keep freeing nodes until all have been removed
00365         while (*head != NULL)
00366         {
00367                 // Preserve a pointer to the current head
00368                 struct FileNode* current = *head;
00369 
00370                 // Advance the head to the next node
00371                 *head = (*head)->next;
00372 
00373                 // Free the previous head
00374                 free(current->fileName);
00375                 free(current);
00376         }
00377 }
